newsitem.title: USA: AMEX to trade options on new Year 2000 index.
newsitem.headline: AMEX to trade options on new Year 2000 index.

text.p: The American Stock Exchange (AMEX) said Thursday it would begin trading options on a new index made up of companies dealing with the so-called millennium bug.
Options on the de Jager Year 2000 index .YTK will begin trading on March 18, the exchange said. It said strike levels and expiration months will be announced prior to the start of trading.
The index is made up of 18 stocks of companies involved in solving the Year 2000 problem that could lead to global computer glitches on January 1, 2000.
The problem arises because most software programs use two digits to specify the year, so on January 1, 2000, many computers will not know what date it is.
The new index was developed by the AMEX and de Jager & Co Ltd, a computer consulting firm.
The 18 components include American Management Systems Inc, Analysts International Corp, CIBER Inc, Computer Associates International Inc and Computer Horizons Corp.
Also, Computer Sciences Corp, Compuware Corp, Data Dimensions Inc, Dun & Bradstreet Corp, Electronic Data Systems Corp and Information Management Resources Inc.
Intersolv Inc, Keane Inc, PeopleSoft Inc, Platinum Technology Inc, Sterling Software Inc, Viasoft Inc and Zitel Corp round out the components.
The AMEX said Group One Trading LP has been named the specialist unit for the YTK options.
The index was down 0.14 at 231.14 in late morning trading Thursday.
